message_1: Consider a Morse-Smale complex with 7 critical points on a surface. The index of critical points are as follows: 1 index-0 point, 3 index-1 points, and 3 index-2 points. What is the Euler characteristic of the Morse-Smale complex?
message_2:
The Euler characteristic of a Morse-Smale complex can be computed using the alternating sum of the number of critical points of each index. In this case, we have:

χ = (# of index-0 points) - (# of index-1 points) + (# of index-2 points)

Plugging in the given values, we get:

χ = (1) - (3) + (3)

χ = 1

So, the Euler characteristic of the Morse-Smale complex is 1.
